thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: Pre-1972 Music Acts Get a Little Help From Their Friends in Congress

author: John D. McKinnon
title: Pre-1972 Music Acts Get a Little Help From Their Friends in Congress
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”The U.S. House passed compromise legislation Wednesday to update copyright laws for the music-streaming era and help performers of pre-1972 recordings get paid for the re-use of their works.
The vote was 415-0. Backers hope the overwhelming House vote will provide momentum to the measure. The Senate is expected to take up the issue in coming weeks.
